text: Which of the following characteristics is not possessed by most plants? Ability to
explanation: Most plants cannot move away from stimuli. While some plants exhibit movement in response to stimuli (a phenomenon known as tropism), this is not a characteristic most plants possess. Respiration, reproduction, and adaptation to the environment are all fundamental characteristics of plants.

text:
A urine sample of a patient, tested with Benedict/Fehling solution, gave an orange colored precipitate,
indicating the presence of
explanation: Though the Benedict's and Fehling's tests are tests for sugars but the Fehling's test can only detect monosaccharides. So, though the sample gets result with the Benedict's test, the test only yields result with the Fehling's solution if it is a monosaccharide e.g glucose, fructose and galactose.

The structure labelled VIII in the diagram is responsible for

Which of the following occurs when a person looks at a distant, dim object and then looks
at a much closer, bright object? In each eye, the pupil becomes

options.A: larger, while the lens becomes thicker
options.B: larger, while the lens becomes thinner
options.C: smaller, while the lens becomes thicker
options.D: smaller while the lens becomes thinner

explanation:
A person struggling to quickly adjust their vision from looking at a distant, dim object to a much closer, bright object is likely experiencing difficulty with accommodation, the eye's ability to change focus between near and far objects.
During accommodation (the eye's process of focusing), the pupil constricts (gets smaller), and the lens becomes thicker. This thickening of the lens is caused by the ciliary muscles contracting, which relaxes the suspensory ligaments holding the lens in place, allowing it to become more rounded and thus thicker. The pupil constriction helps to increase the depth of focus and reduce light scattering at the periphery of the cornea, further improving the clarity of the image.

text: The following insects undergo incomplete metamorphosis except
The process by which fruits develop without fertilization is called
Which of the following groups contains only macro-nutrients?
A solution which contains all the required elements in their correct proportions is known as a
The deficiency of manganese in plants results in?
explanation: Manganese deficiency can be easy to spot in plants because, much like Magnesium deficiency (agriculture), the leaves start to turn yellow and undergo interveinal chlorosis. The difference between these two is that the younger leaves near the top of the plant show symptoms first because manganese is not mobile while in magnesium deficiency show symptoms in older leaves near the bottom of the plant.

If a piece of abandoned farmland went through a series of floral and faunal changes and became established with
permanent plant and animal population, it could be said to have undergone
The drugs which inhibit the growth of disease-causing organisms and thus used in the treatment of infections are referred to as
explanation:
The drugs that inhibit the growth of disease-causing organisms and are used to treat infections are referred to as antibiotics.
Antibiotics are medications that target bacteria and are used to treat and prevent bacterial infections. They can either kill bacteria or stop them from reproducing, allowing the body's natural defenses to eliminate them.

text: What will be the genotypic ratio when two heterozygous red pea plants are crossed?
Which of the following traits in humans can be affected by environmental factors?
Heterozygous tall plants were crossed with pure-breeding dwarf plants of the same species. What were the approximate percentages of the offspring?
explanation: A heterozygous tall plant (say Tt) crossed with pure-breeding dwarf plants (tt) will give a set of Tt, Tt, tt and tt. This is 50% tall and 50% dwarf approximately.
